originalText.text: My Mom 93 years old has dementia just broke her heap absolutely no help from river spring very bad and sad situation and we stay with company almost 10 years

originalText.text:
Never in my life have I felt more disrespected than on the phone with CM E.M. regarding my father and his health services.  She is rude, condescending, aggressive and simply mean spirited.  I am not sure how she has a job in the human service field, but i'm guessing that the labor shortage crisis is the reason.  -Gaby Koval-Velis 11/26/2022
ADDING: I left a message for the supervisor of the CM and post 24 hours and no call back.   Waiting for the post that says to call their main number because customer service is their main concern....

originalText.text: I don't know how they work with patients, but I tried to get a job from their Intake department which located in Brooklyn between Kings Hwy/E 15th ST. They are awful people to work with I can tell, the company cultural will disappoint you, I might not be the best candidate for them, I wasted my time went to their office, had an interview with them. First the intake department manager named Darya P contacted me that they would like to interview me with the intake director Elena, After the interview, they didn't even bother to send me a message or email that they decided not moving forward with my application at the moment, nothing but such a disrespectful action from these people, without the most basic moral quality,  such poor management.

originalText.text: Avoid at all costs! Case managers are so rude! Grandfather is suffering from dementia and severe health problems. They refuse to add hours to his case even though I have all the medical documentation and paperwork to support his need for extended care. The case manager is extremely rude and dismissive! She’ll ask me a question and won’t even allow me to answer. Will be moving to a new agency immediately.
